channel.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
channel.description: Long story short I had to reformat my computet twice in a row then after that I've been having a few problems. SO, whenver my computer has to load anything from small things like loading a web page, my computer lags, by lag I meen my music starts to skip and RS lags badly for a few seconds(complete screen freezage).

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @pesky pesky
item.description:
@pesky wrote:

did you unplug modem when you done ya pc? happened to me once, also could be a virus

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

get new chipset…the light didn’t show up…the moniter didnt pop up…the grpahics wasn’t booting for me when my chipset went bad

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @jcs_double jcs_double
item.description:
@jcs_double wrote:

check if you have all the upto date drivers and make surethere arnt any in the device manager the have a little yellow “!” beside them

item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Have you installed your video card drivers? Have you preformed spyware/virus scans? Have you reduced your startup list to ONLY needed programs?

Read full topic

Download System Mechanic 6 Pro, it will help improve your computer.

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Zigon Zigon
item.description:
@Zigon wrote:

K after exiting everything I think I could right now I’m running 43 processes.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

16 now, I only have four processes running under my username, 10 under system, 1 under local service and one under network service

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:11, topic:17162”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=25697.msg293286#msg293286 date=1160195385]

I suggest doing what everyone else has said. Go to Task Manager, and end all the processes you don’t need. You shouldn’t really have more than 10-15 processes running. If you are running something you don’t need, end it.

Are you insane? WinXP has at leaste 25-30 processes even right after a reformat.
[/quote]
I’m at 15 processes on WinXP Pro and I literally just reformated again :)[/quote]
Hmm… I usually get at leaste 20.

Right now I have 41 processes, yet it’s running very fast.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:10, topic:17162”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=25697.msg292912#msg292912 date=1160184618]
I suggest doing what everyone else has said. Go to Task Manager, and end all the processes you don’t need. You shouldn’t really have more than 10-15 processes running. If you are running something you don’t need, end it.
[/quote]
Are you insane? WinXP has at leaste 25-30 processes even right after a reformat.[/quote]
I’m at 15 processes on WinXP Pro and I literally just reformated again

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Mr.Chris:

I suggest doing what everyone else has said. Go to Task Manager, and end all the processes you don’t need. You shouldn’t really have more than 10-15 processes running. If you are running something you don’t need, end it.

Are you insane? WinXP has at leaste 25-30 processes even right after a reformat.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Yeh, don’t shut down SYSTEM or anything else, lol. Just processes being run by your user.

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Zigon Zigon
item.description:
@Zigon wrote:

K I checked that out and I actually have atleast 30+ processes running, I’ve closed some but a lot of them I have no idea what they do.[br][size=1]Posted at: October 06, 2006, 04:45:30 PM[/size][hr]Lol k I closed a svchost.exe and my computer is counting down to shut down.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I suggest doing what everyone else has said. Go to Task Manager, and end all the processes you don’t need. You shouldn’t really have more than 10-15 processes running. If you are running something you don’t need, end it.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @Zigon Zigon
item.description:
@Zigon wrote:

Alright thanks, I also think what therealjdb said was right about a hardware conflict. Since doing that I’ve been having problems with my usb software(web cam, wireless adapter), also for some reason the blue light on my power button sometimes doesn’t light up even tho the computers on.

item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Yes, you do have too many processes running. Press Alt + Ctrl + Del and check how many processes are running. Most virus scanners take a lot of ram.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?

item.title: Why is my computer suddenly lagging with 1.5 gigs of ram?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

I’ve been reformating for the last two days(not constantly) and I finally got mine working and have 1.5 gigs or ram, no lag. I’d have to say in your case that you might have downloaded something bad or have a hardware conflict
